newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ wool prices mixed at Christchurch/Napier sales.
newsitem.headline: NZ wool prices mixed at Christchurch/Napier sales.

text.p: Wool prices were mixed but generally unchanged at wool sales at Christchurch and Napier on Thursday, Wools of New Zealand said.
The market indicator fell three cents to 445 cents with the fine segment up 12 to 818 cents, the medium up two to 526, strong down two to 397 and lamb down nine to 401.
Main buying interest came from China, Western Europe, local mills, Nepal, Turkey and Australia with support from the U.S. and India.

Merino fleece was up to 2 percent dearer, halfbred fleece up to 2 percent dearer, crossbred fleece 0-1 percent dearer, cotts and second shear unchanged, first lambs 27-29 micron 2.5 percent dearer, 30-32 micron 2-4 percent cheaper, second lambs 2.5-5.0 percent dearer, bulky skirtings 0-2 percent cheaper.
The next sale is at Christchurch on February 13.
